SENT.plain: BACKGROUND: The role of cryoballoon pulmonary vein isolation for the treatment of atrial fibrillation (AF) is unclear

METHODS AND RESULTS: In a 61-year-old man with persistent AF and severe mitral valve regurgitation, surgical cryoballoon pulmonary vein isolation was performed during open-heart surgery, without complication
CONCLUSION: Surgical cryoballoon ablation is feasible and can effectively isolate PV
